jobs_results.title: Android Engineer - Remote - Brazil
jobs_results.description:
Our healthcare insurance client is hiring an Android Developer. This is a 6 month contract with the option for extensions and is remote work from home. We are recruiting for candidates located in Brazil and are paying $25.00/hour USD.

This role is to help support a large mobile initiative to create a super app! This is a UI redesign and refresh. We are looking for a Android Developer with very strong Kotlin experience.

We are a company committed to creating diverse and inclusive environments where people can bring their full, authentic selves to work every day. We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer that believes everyone matters. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment regardless of their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, national origin, ancestry, genetic factors, age, disability, protected veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please send a request to HR@insightglobal.com.

To learn more about how we collect, keep, and process your private information, please review Insight Global's Workforce Privacy Policy: https://insightglobal.com/workforce-privacy-policy/ .

jobs_results.title: Junior/Mid Level Android Engineer, UK
jobs_results.description:
Junior/Mid-Level Android (Java/Kotlin) Engineer

Location: Fully Remote

Salary: ¬£30-45k

About

About Boxbar:

Boxbar Tech is the world's first automated self-service drinks solution able to dispense a full drinks menu. We are on a mission to reshape the landscape of bar service at events, venues and within the hospitality sector globally with our one-of-a-kind technology.

For events and venues grappling with unprecedented cost increases and operational inefficiencies, beverage service has never been more vital but at major events it remains defined by long queues, poor quality drinks and low customer satisfaction. We exist to solve this problem!

Our mission is to revolutionise the experience with innovation and a premium level of service that increases service speeds, efficiencies, profits and customer satisfaction levels for our partners. We are proud to work with major events, festivals, venues, sports clubs and hospitality organisations around the world including Live Nation, ASM Global, LIV Golf, Levy, Sodexo, Peppermint, AEG Presents, Dreamland, Parklife Festival, Juventus, London Stadium, Birmingham City FC, Ibiza Rocks, Co-op Live, Download Festival and many more.

Role

We are looking for a skilled Android (Java/Kotlin) Engineer to join our team. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining our Android application, ensuring it runs seamlessly on our custom hardware.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain the Android application for our custom hardware.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate to define, design, and ship new features.
‚Ä¢ Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot and resolve bugs.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with hardware to ensure proper integration of the app with our custom hardware.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in Android development.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Kotlin.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect Android applications to back-end services.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of the full mobile development life cycle.
‚Ä¢ Experience with custom hardware integration is a plus.

If you don't meet every single requirement, we'd still encourage you to apply. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you are excited about this role we would still like you to apply.

Benefits

Benefits & Perks also include:
‚Ä¢ Minimum 25 days holiday plus bank holidays
‚Ä¢ Discretionary flexible working
‚Ä¢ Pension
‚Ä¢ Duvet morning on your Birthday
‚Ä¢ Training programmes
‚Ä¢ Regular team drinks & outings
‚Ä¢ Regular team lunches
‚Ä¢ Value driven start-up culture
‚Ä¢ Potential for share options
‚Ä¢ The chance to be part of a cutting-edge company in the beverage industry

If you're passionate about Android development and eager to work on groundbreaking projects, we'd love to hear from you!

jobs_results.title: Android Developer Kotlin
jobs_results.description:
Senior Android Developer - Remote

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Android Developer to work on the development of various client projects. The successful applicant will work on greenfield development and BAU development projects using Android and surrounding tech such as Kotlin & Jetpack Compose.
About the Role

We are a digital agency that values personal development and progression. Our team members have their own personal development plans, with a clear pathway into a Technical Lead role.
Your Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Utilize expertise in Kotlin, Jetpack Compose, and PlayStore
‚Ä¢ Implement unit testing and test-driven development (TDD) best practices
What We Offer

Fully remote work arrangement for UK-based candidates

Flexible hours and holiday days to balance work and life commitments

Personal development plan to inspire growth and progression within your role
Requirements
‚Ä¢ Prior experience in Android Mobile App Development
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a fast-paced environment
‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills
‚Ä¢ Expertise in Kotlin, Jetpack Compose, and PlayStore
‚Ä¢ Experience with Unit Testing / TDD

The estimated salary for this role is ¬£55,000.

jobs_results.title: iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
About us

All In The Loop is an event technology company which has supported over 10,000 events worldwide. We provide customized apps that improve networking, registration and badging systems. Our team and knowledge have grown since our inception in 2015 and we feel we have the best offering and service in the business.

The IOS Developer role is a newly created role to keep up with the demand of our ever-growing client base, as well as supporting our existing apps. In this role, you will be instrumental in developing and maintaining our iOS applications. Working within an Agile framework, you will deliver innovative and robust solutions, ensuring our software is flexible, reliable, efficient, and secure.

Key Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Collaborating with teams to design, build and continuous improvements of their IOS platforms
‚Ä¢ Involved in the upgrades legacy IOS application to modern frameworks
‚Ä¢ Convert product and architecture requirements into code with accurate timeframes and delivery estimates.
‚Ä¢ Ensure top-notch code quality by adhering to best practices and coding standards.
‚Ä¢ Maintain various applications and services to support our platform.
‚Ä¢ Stay proficient in multiple mobile development technologies, coding languages, and disciplines.

Skills and Experience:
‚Ä¢ Background in iOS Development and Swift
‚Ä¢ Experience with Swift, SwiftUI, Xcode, and testing with tools such as XCTest.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of web technologies and UI/UX standards.
‚Ä¢ Understand Google‚Äôs design principles and interface guidelines.
‚Ä¢ Experience with performance and memory optimisation using tools like Android Studio Profiler.
‚Ä¢ Familiar with cloud message APIs and push notifications.
‚Ä¢ Proficient in code versioning tools like Git.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Android development is a plus but not required.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with industry best practices, development processes, and methodologies.
‚Ä¢ Experience delivering complex software solutions in an Agile setting.

All In The Loop is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or nationality.

The Benefits ‚Äì What we‚Äôll do for you

An exciting and supportive office culture with regular socials and team events

Weekly team meetings to support wellbeing and professional growth

Casual dress

Pizza Fridays

Ping Pong Table & Darts

Bonus pay

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: ¬£30,000.00-¬£45,000.00 per year

Additional pay:
‚Ä¢ Bonus scheme

Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Company pension
‚Ä¢ Flexitime

Schedule:
‚Ä¢ 8 hour shift
‚Ä¢ Day shift
‚Ä¢ Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:
‚Ä¢ Wilmslow: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person

jobs_results.title: Mobile Engineering Manager
jobs_results.description:
OVERVIEW:

Join our team as a Mobile Engineering Manager! Not only will you will be managing a team of Engineers, you will be using your skills, knowledge and experience to help shape the future of Gymshark's digital ecosystem and drive business success through our apps (both Android and iOS) ensuring they meet the highest standards of quality and scalability.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:
‚Ä¢ Managing, leading and mentoring a team of engineers of differential capability
‚Ä¢ Managing team backlog
‚Ä¢ Utilising experience as an Engineer to make data led decisions for the team and work prioritisation
‚Ä¢ Encouraging the team to think creatively and critically to product innovative and ground breaking mobile digital products
‚Ä¢ Empowering Engineers to achieve a consistent high bar of engineering excellence in their work
‚Ä¢ Collaborating with other Engineering Managers and Heads-of to form a ‚Äòone-team' fully aligned on general engineering approach and delivery requirements
‚Ä¢ Supporting direct reports to independently pull and deliver feedback, sympathetic to areas of specific developmental importance
‚Ä¢ Making significant improvements to internal processes to ensure projects are delivered to deadlines, and therefore budget
‚Ä¢ Ensuring a good level of personal and team understanding of Agile's 12 principles

WHAT YOU'LL NEED:

Essential Criteria:
‚Ä¢ Experience as a Mobile Engineer, specialising in either Kotlin or Swift
‚Ä¢ Successfully managed, led and mentored a team of Engineers
‚Ä¢ Proven work experience in working on mobile applications
‚Ä¢ Experience working within an agile framework
‚Ä¢ Strong commercial acumen and ability to build relationships across Tech and the wider Gymshark business

This is a hybrid role and would require the successful candidate to attend at least 3 days a week in GSHQ, Solihull, UK.

CLOSING DATE: 4th April 2024

BELONGING AT GYMSHARK.

Our mission is to be a place where everyone belongs. We‚Äôre an equal opportunities employer, and for us that means we always strive to be as inclusive as possible in all aspects of employment, right from your application. We‚Äôre committed to finding reasonable adjustments* for candidates with specific needs or have a disability during our recruitment process, and all applicants will be considered fairly and equally. We do not tolerate discrimination of any kind. *If you‚Äôd like to request a reasonable adjustment please email talent@gymshark.com.

ABOUT US.

We‚Äôre here to unite the conditioning community. We believe that putting the sweat in today, prepares us for tomorrow. So, we give people the tools they need to reach further, go faster, be stronger. We celebrate those who show up ‚Äì for themselves ‚Äì to be their physical or mental best, whatever that means for them. It‚Äôs what we want for our community, and our team. A team that‚Äôs growing rapidly around the world. A collective of talented individuals working together to invent Gymshark‚Äôs future. Our plans are ambitious, and we‚Äôre looking for people who want to join us for the ride ‚Äì our growth will be your growth.

THE PERKS.

üôå Competitive ‚ÄòWin Together, Lose Together‚Äô Bonus
ü©∫ Choice of Private Medical Insurance or Healthcare Cash Plan, paid for by us!
üèñ 25 days holidays + your birthday and all the Bank Holidays which can be substituted and taken whenever you want.
üíª A truly Flexible Working Culture

üí∞ Employer pension contributions up to 7%
ü§© Life Assurance at four times your basic salary

ü•á Financial, Physical and Mental Wellbeing Support

jobs_results.title: Mobile Engineer. (contract)
jobs_results.description:
Job Title: Mobile Engineer (IOS & Android)

Location: Sunbury-on-Thames (Hybrid)

Contract Length: 6 months

Industry: Oil and Energy, Tech

Working Hours: 8 per day/ 40 per week

Dynamo is on a mission to optimise front line operations on the planet.

Over 800 million front line workers work in heavy industry across six million sites globally. Their work is risky and complex, in often remote locations. They still deal with a lot of paper, multiple (clunky) software tools and manual processes to simply get work done. This means many avoidable health and safety incidents and enormous waste in work execution. Every 10 seconds, someone loses their life in a work-related incident. Dynamo will change this by optimising how front-line work gets planned and executed.

Dynamo's platform and connected apps allow front-line teams to plan work, perform risk assessments, request work permits, record observations, get alerted on health and safety risks in real-time (e.g. fatigue or exclusion zones), and share lessons learnt.

Why join the team:
‚Ä¢ Dynamo is solving a problem that touches the lives of millions of front line workers globally and enables them to return home safe to their families after every shift
‚Ä¢ We have significant pull from customers and have signed multi-year deals with enterprise customers already
‚Ä¢ High calibre team and a culture of continuous innovation, customer centricity and fast-paced execution
‚Ä¢ Joining us at this stage means you get to shape the product.

So, if you are someone who enjoys solving big problems, thrives on challenges and ambiguous situations, is hands-on and not afraid of executing at pace ‚Äì join Dynamo on its mission to optimise front line operations on the planet.

What you will do:
‚Ä¢ Design, develop and test new features for our expanding product suite.
‚Ä¢ Develop features for a native mobile application on iOS and Android.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with other web and mobile developers as we build our server-driven UI platform
‚Ä¢ Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle
‚Ä¢ Work independently and own feature development from concept to delivery.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the engineering team and contribute to the overall design of the system.
‚Ä¢ Develop automated tests and conduct performance tuning
‚Ä¢ Contribute to code reviews

What you will have:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in a technical field, computer science, software engineering or similar.
‚Ä¢ 7+ years experience in software development, with a strong emphasis on mobile development
‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of native mobile development for iOS or Android using Swift UI or Jetpack Compose
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of composable design patterns
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of SOLID principles and Test Driven Development
‚Ä¢ Experience with Microservices, gRPC, containerisation and Kubernetes
‚Ä¢ Experience with Cloud platforms in either Azure of AWS
‚Ä¢ Familiar with SQL and NoSQL databases
‚Ä¢ Familiar with Agile, DevOps, Gitops and CI/CD pipelines

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs_results.title: Android Developer for Reddit
jobs_results.description:
Reddit is seeking an experienced Android Developer to join our team. As a member of our team, you will be responsible for designing, building, and shipping features to support international growth. This role involves working closely with other developers to contribute to standards that improve developer workflows and mentoring engineers on the team.
Job Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Minimum 5+ years of professional software development experience developing user-facing Android mobile native applications at scale.
‚Ä¢ Experience with modern Android development frameworks such as Jetpack Compose and Kotlin coroutines.
‚Ä¢ Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks.
Estimated Salary: $150,000 - $200,000 per year
What We Offer:
‚Ä¢ A comprehensive benefits package including pension scheme, private medical and dental scheme, life assurance, income protection, workspace benefit for your home office, personal & professional development funds, family planning support, commuter benefits, flexible vacation & Reddit Global Days Off.

jobs_results.title: Mobile Software Developer Android Kotlin
jobs_results.description:
Mobile Software Engineer Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Mobile Software Engineer to join our team at Foresight Mobile in Stockport.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in mobile app development and be proficient in languages such as Flutter, iOS, and Android.

This is a full-time position with flexible working hours and the opportunity to work on a wide range of exciting projects.
Key Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Design and develop high-quality digital experiences across iOS, Android, and the Web.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with startups, big brands, and top sports teams to deliver successful projects.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the CTO and business owners to ensure project success.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of Flutter, iOS, and Android development.
‚Ä¢ Experience with cross-platform development using frameworks like React or Vue.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in one or more of the following languages: Java, TypeScript, or C++.
‚Ä¢ Good communication and problem-solving skills.
‚Ä¢ Able to learn new skills and technologies quickly.
What We Offer:
‚Ä¢ Competitive salary based on experience (approximately ¬£50,000 - ¬£80,000 per year).
‚Ä¢ Flexible working hours and remote work options.
‚Ä¢ Ongoing training and professional development opportunities.
‚Ä¢ A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
About Foresight Mobile:

Foresight Mobile is a leading mobile app development agency based in Stockport. We specialize in delivering high-quality digital experiences for clients across various industries.

If you are passionate about mobile app development and want to join a dynamic and innovative team, please submit your application.

jobs_results.title: Lead Mobile Developer - React Native
jobs_results.description:
Lead Mobile App Developer

Are you ready to take your expertise in mobile app development to the next level?

Our client, a forward-thinking technology leader, is seeking a Lead Mobile App Developer to shape the future of their app ecosystem. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a small, close-knit team, spearhead innovation, and work on products that engage a global audience.

Why This Role is Great
‚Ä¢ Pivotal Impact: Lead the development of hybrid apps that are the backbone of a high-traffic business.
‚Ä¢ Technical Leadership: Manage and mentor a small team, including contractors, setting standards and driving technical excellence.
‚Ä¢ Innovative Tech Stack: Work with React Native, TypeScript, and integrate custom solutions using Kotlin (Android) and Swift (iOS).
‚Ä¢ Hybrid Working: Enjoy the flexibility of remote work, transitioning to a hybrid model next summer with 2-3 days in the Campden office.
‚Ä¢ Professional Growth: Tackle exciting challenges like white-label product development and hybrid frameworks.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing
‚Ä¢ Leading app development initiatives, ensuring high-quality, performant releases.
‚Ä¢ Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and shape project goals.
‚Ä¢ Streamlining processes with automation and setting robust development standards.
‚Ä¢ Overseeing the integration of modern APIs and native functionality.
‚Ä¢ Playing a key role in enhancing the customer experience for a global audience.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

Our ideal candidate brings a blend of technical expertise, leadership ability, and adaptability:

Core Skills:
‚Ä¢ React Native proficiency with demonstrable experience publishing iOS apps.
‚Ä¢ Expertise in TypeScript, REST APIs, and webviews.
‚Ä¢ Experience customizing with Kotlin and Swift in hybrid app environments.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of app security practices and CI/CD for mobile apps.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of agile workflows.

Bonus Points for:
‚Ä¢ Experience with white-label app development.
‚Ä¢ Proven success leading small teams and managing workloads.
‚Ä¢ A portfolio of published apps or contributions to app stores.

Why Join Our Client

Our client is dedicated to creating a workplace that inspires and supports its people:
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive Benefits: Private healthcare, gym membership, pension plan, and life assurance.
‚Ä¢ Work-Life Balance: Flexible hybrid working, free parking, and a short walk from Watford Junction station.
‚Ä¢ Personal Growth: Access to advanced learning resources and performance tools for continuous feedback.
‚Ä¢ Engaging Environment: An in-house chef, open-plan workspace, and a vibrant culture of collaboration.

Diversity & Inclusion

Our client is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. They celebrate diversity and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.
